bibl.title: Letter from W.H. Hoffmann to Philip Showalter Hench, December 3, 1941

div1.p: Hoffmann informs Hench that he has been working on yellow fever for the last 25 years. He is the Director of the Yellow Fever Department at the Finlay Institute. Hoffmann would like to obtain several hundred copies of one of Hench's yellow fever publications to distribute among his friends.

div1.head: Letter from W.H. Hoffmann to Philip Showalter Hench, December 3, 1941
div1.opener:
Habana, Cuba 3 Dec 41
Cerro 1381
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
I read your article on Yellow
Fever in Hygeia of Nov 41. duly,

To-day I saw a reprint of yours
of this paper.

I am working since 25 years on
yellow fever exclusively and Director
of the Yellow Fever Department of the
Finlay.

I have already asked the Editor of
Hygeia to give me the price of 100 or
200 copies of the colored picture
which you published with your article,
and which I want to distribute
to my friends of other Tropical Institutes
who have the same interests as I,
together with my own publications, which I regularly
am sending them

I see however that it would still
more correspond t to my purpose,
if I may have 100 or 200 copies of
your article, in the same form as you
had put it published. (with the colored picture)

I should be very grateful if
you might Kindly ask the
Publishers at which price they
can make those reprints for me;
I think that my distribution in would
be in your interest at the same time,
because I am related since decennia
with the specialists of the whole world.

With my best thanks and
compliments I am
div1.closer:
Yours very sincerely Prof W. H. Hoffmann M. D, I forgot to congratulate you on your
fine article, but from this letter you
see how much I appreciate it
